question: The "Ming Treasure Voyages" were the medieval maritime expeditions undertaken by which nation?
explanation: Ming Dynasty was ruling China from 1368 AD to 1644 AD. Between 1405 AD to 1433 AD, this dynasty under the Emperor Yongle sanctioned seven maritime expeditions to coastal territories and islands in and around the South China Sea and the Indian Ocean. These seven fleets carried heavy military equipment and great treasures to project Chinese power and wealth to the host nations.
